name: Wakie
headline: A social app for phone calls. Express yourself and make real friends.
description: Users perform millions of calls and send hundreds of millions of messages every month. The topics vary from language practicing to mental issues to personal life conversations.

founders.name: Grachik Adzhamian, Founder
founders.description: Built four successful companies, currently working on the biggest thing in my life

generated_description:
Wakie is an innovative social app designed for meaningful phone conversations, aiming to connect users and help them express themselves and cultivate real friendships. Founded in 2014 by brothers Hrachik Adjamian and Tat Ajamyan, Wakie emerged from Y Combinator's Winter 2016 batch and has quickly grown into a dynamic platform with thousands of users engaging in millions of calls every month.

Located in Menlo Park, CA, Wakie operates with a small yet dedicated team of ten. The app thrives on a strong community spirit, allowing users to discuss a variety of topics—from language practice and mental health to everyday life challenges. It’s this diverse range of discussions that enriches the user experience, fostering genuine connections.

The app operates simply yet effectively. Users set a topic—like wanting to practice Spanish or seeking advice on personal issues—and are matched with someone interested in chatting about that subject. What sets Wakie apart from mainstream social media platforms is the emphasis on anonymity and the absence of judgment; it creates a safe space for individuals to open up and explore deeper connections.

Wakie's commitment to promoting mental health and community building is evident in its user testimonials. Many long-term members report forming genuine friendships through the app, highlighting its role as a therapeutic outlet. The media has taken notice too, with mentions in outlets like BBC and TechCrunch talking about its potential to reshape how we communicate.

In terms of ethos, Wakie's manifesto champions deep conversations, fun interactions, and stands firmly against bullying and discrimination. They truly aim to redefine what social media can be—a space where people embrace their authentic selves rather than curating a false persona for likes and shares.

With a straightforward, engaging approach and a growing global community, Wakie is not just another app; it’s a movement towards better communication and genuine friendships in an age often dominated by superficial interactions. Want to join the conversation? You can learn more and download the app at [Wakie's official website](http://www.wakie.com).
